profile_positions.description:
With Trafeo, we are committed to helping businesses to achieve their full potential
Our MIssion: Technology meets business values

As CEO, I am responsible for creating, planning, implementing, and integrating the strategic direction of Trafeo. Since its a small company my role does not only contained to these areas, I'm also involved in plans ensuring the alignment with short-term and long-term objectives. 

Key investors for inorganic growth in our product development pillar is my focus area for 2019
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
CarNext is a technology company determined to disrupt the used car market. Trust, efficiency, and transparency define our customer-centric process. In less than two years, CarNext.com has re-defined how people buy, lease and finance their next cars. Our high-volume platform has been used by over 1 million people. It is currently the largest pan-European digital platform for high quality used cars.

As a Product owner, It's my responsibility to enable E-commerce flow for Europe to deliver any car anytime anywhere experience to customers. A customer can seamlessly go through the complete method of finding a Car (local or cross-border) with extra services and buying them (with choices for finance or trade-in) online.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Leaseweb is a global hosting company with offices in Europe, Asia, and the United States. An internet services company headquartered in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

Leaseweb Cloud environments offer what suit your unique business requirements. The neutral and flexible approach allows Leaseweb to make the best decisions for their customers – working with Apache, Microsoft, VMware, and more to provide high-performance infrastructure. Leaseweb based their cloud solutions on resources, not physical server units, and let customers manage their own virtualized environments. Deploy the components however you want, whenever you want
profile_positions.title: Held 2 roles: Scrum Master & Product Owner - Cloud

profile_positions.description:
Hyves was a social networking site in the Netherlands with mainly Dutch visitors and members, where it competed with sites such as Facebook and MySpace. Hyves was founded in 2004. In May 2010 Hyves had more than 10.3 million accounts. These correspond to two thirds of the size of the Dutch population (which stood at over 16 million in 2010), however this included multiple accounts per person and inactive accounts. The number of accounts had grown by over two million as compared to 1.5 years earlier. Hyves could be used free of charge, but there was an option for a paid Premium Membership (called "Gold Membership"). Gold members had access to some extra features, such as the ability to use a wider variety of smilies in their messages and more uploading space for pictures. The creators have said that the basis of a Hyves account will always be free.

In 2013, the social network was officially discontinued, due to the huge decrease in accounts due to the growing popularity of other social networks like Facebook and Twitter in the Netherlands. The site continued as Hyves Games, where members could use their Hyves accounts to play social games.
profile_positions.title: Core Developer / Agile evangelist

profile_positions.description:
Nivio was a company marketing desktop virtualization services that allow a customer to use computer application software without a personal computer.

nivio is a World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer (2009) and a global cloud-computing innovator; with a unique vision of saving time and money by removing computing constraints and providing ubiquitous access everywhere. nivio’s flagship service is the world’s first Windows-based Online Desktop that enable customers to access a personal virtual desktop from any device connected to the internet. The nDesktop Service provides unrestricted storage and power, wherever you are with the ability to rent original and updated software on a rental (pay as you go) basis; liberating users from the traditional constraints of computing.
profile_positions.title: Lead Innovator / Team Manager

company.name: G4S, Information Technology India pvt. Ltd

profile_positions.description:
G4S plc (formerly Group 4 Securicor) is a British multinational security services company headquartered in London, England.
G4S is the world's largest security company measured by revenues. It has operations in more than 90 countries. With over 570,000 employees, it is the world's third-largest private employer, the largest European and African private employer, and among the largest on the London Stock Exchange.

I was working with the Information & Technology department, which was situated in Eurasia HQ back then as a Sr. Software engineer. 
My Role was:
* Writing code for msot of the security products.
* Went overseas for short project implementation for clients of G4S
* Identify, understand and plan for organizational and human impacts of planned systems, and ensure that new technical requirements are properly integrated with existing processes and skill sets.
* Plan a system flow from the ground up.
* Interact with internal users and customers to learn and document requirements that are then used to produce business required documents.
* Write technical requirements from a critical phase.
* Interact with software architect to understand software limitations.
* Help new programmers during system development, e.g. provide use cases, flowcharts, UML and BPMN diagrams.
* Document requirements or contribute to user manuals.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Software engineer
